remarks: A sequence of functions converges uniformly iff it is uniformly Cauchy, which is to say that for every ` 0 < x ` there is a ` j ` such that for all ` j <_ k , m ` the functions ` F ( k ) ` and ` F ( m ) ` are uniformly within ` x ` of each other on ` S ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Mar-2015.)
